questions.text: Fick's law of diffusion is dependent on all except:

options.label: C
options.text: The molecular weight of the gas

questions.correct_answer: D. The posture of the subject
questions.explanation: Ans. D) The posture of the subject

questions.text: Which of the following transport mechanism does not require ATP: Select the correct answer

Electrical transmission: gap junction Negative feedback inhibition: Renshaw cell Synaptic vesicle docking and fusion: presynaptic nerve terminal End plate potential: muscarinic cholinergic receptor Action potential generation: initial segment

This altered structure is analogous to which structure found in skeletal muscle?

A 35-year-old woman sees her physician to report muscle weakness in the extraocular eye muscles and muscles of the extremities. She states that she feels fine when she gets up in the morning, but the weakness begins soon after she becomes active. The weakness is improved by rest. Sensation appears normal. The physician treats her with an anticholinesterase inhibitor, and she notes immediate return of muscle strength. Her physician diagnoses her with
Weber–Fechner law is related to:
All of the following statements regarding the Type I skeletal muscle fibers are correct except:
Which of the following statement about sarcomere arrangements is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Z line is present in the middle of the I band

options.label: B
options.text: I band represents the full length of the Thin filament

options.label: C
options.text: A band represents the full length of the Thin filament

options.label: D
options.text: M line is resent in the middle of the I band

questions.correct_answer: A. Z line is present in the middle of the I band
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Z line is present in the middle of the I band

questions.text: Which of the following events in the muscle contraction process is primarily responsible for the detachment of myosin from actin filaments, allowing the muscle to relax?

options.label: B
options.text: Cessation of calcium release from the sarcoplasmic reticulum

options.label: C
options.text: Dissociation of ADP and Pi from the myosin head

options.label: D
options.text: Attachment of ATP to the myosin head

questions.correct_answer: D. Attachment of ATP to the myosin head
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Attachment of ATP to the myosin head

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the physiological response to an increase in blood pressure, mediated by baroreceptors?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased vasomotor tone and sympathetic activation

options.label: B
options.text: Stimulation of the vasodilator area and inhibition of the vasoconstrictor area

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased vagal tone leading to tachycardia

options.label: D
options.text: Increased secretion of epinephrine from the adrenal medulla

questions.correct_answer: B. Stimulation of the vasodilator area and inhibition of the vasoconstrictor area
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Stimulation of the vasodilator area and inhibition of the vasoconstrictor area

questions.text: Curve B in the figure represents:
All of the following statements are true about the absolute refractory period in the ventricles, except:

options.label: A
options.text: Is the period when the ventricles are completely inexcitable.

options.label: B
options.text: Corresponds to the period of ventricular depolarization.

options.label: C
options.text: Corresponds approximately to the period of ventricular contraction.

options.label: D
options.text: Is shorter than the corresponding period in atrial muscle.

questions.correct_answer: D. Is shorter than the corresponding period in atrial muscle.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Is shorter than the corresponding period in atrial muscle.

questions.text: The third heart sound (S3), which may be heard during auscultation in some clinical conditions, is produced by:

options.label: B
options.text: Closure of the semilunar valves (aortic and pulmonary valves)

options.label: C
options.text: Closure of the atrioventricular valves (mitral and tricuspid valves)

options.label: D
options.text: Rapid filling phase of the ventricles

questions.correct_answer: D. Rapid filling phase of the ventricles
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Rapid filling phase of the ventricles

questions.text: Which of the following accurately describes the cardiovascular regulation?

options.label: A
options.text: Baroreceptors get activated in hypotension and help increase Blood pressure

options.label: B
options.text: Baroreceptors inhibit the nucleus ambiguous which inhibits the sympathetic system

options.label: C
options.text: Nucleus tractus solitarius activates vagal centres

options.label: D
options.text: Vagus nerve carries afferent fibres from carotid sinus baroreceptors

questions.correct_answer: C. Nucleus tractus solitarius activates vagal centres
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Nucleus tractus solitarius activates vagal centres

questions.text: Arterioles offer more resistance to flow than other vessels since they have

options.label: D
options.text: A greater pressure drop along their length.

questions.correct_answer: D. A greater pressure drop along their length.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) A greater pressure drop along their length.

questions.text: Which is correct about the pressure volume loop of left ventricle?
The ratio of stroke volume and arterial compliance approximately determines which of the following?
A healthy, 25-year-old medical student participates in a 20-kilometer charity run for the Indian Medical Association. Which muscles does the student use (contract) during expiration?
questions.correct_answer: C. Internal intercostals and abdominal recti
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Internal intercostals and abdominal recti

questions.text: Which one of the following curve shows oxygen Hb dissociation after anaerobic exercise
The volume–pressure curves shown in the diagram were obtained from a young, healthy subject and a patient. Which of the following best describes the condition of the patient?

A 32 year old man met with a bike accident and handle of bike hit him badly that when he was brought to the hospital. Doctors find out that there is puncture in parietal pleura membrane. True about this condition is?

options.label: A
options.text: Unopposed inward recoil will be there.

options.label: B
options.text: Intra thorax pressure will be zero

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and B are true.

questions.correct_answer: D. Both A and B are true.
questions.explanation: Ans. D)  Both A and B are true.

questions.text: During acclimatization to high altitude all of the following take place except:

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in the sensitivity of central chemoreceptors

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in the sensitivity of carotid body to hypoxia

options.label: D
options.text: Shift in the oxygen dissociation curve to the left

questions.correct_answer: D. Shift in the oxygen dissociation curve to the left
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Shift in the oxygen dissociation curve to the left

questions.text: A 27-year-old man is breathing quietly. He then inhales as much air as possible and exhales as much air as he can, producing the spirogram shown in the figure. What is his inspiratory capacity (in liters)?
Through procedure shown in Image, one can measure:
All of the following statements are true as blood passes through systemic capillaries, except:

options.label: B
options.text: HCO3- ions pass from red cells to plasma.

options.label: C
options.text: Its oxygen dissociation curve shifts to the right.

options.label: D
options.text: Its ability to deliver oxygen to the tissues is enhanced.

questions.text: All of the following statements are true, except, In normal lungs

options.label: A
options.text: The rate of alveolar ventilation at rest exceeds the rate of alveolar capillary perfusion.

options.label: B
options.text: The ventilation/perfusion (V/P) ratio exceeds 1.0 during maximal exercise.

options.label: C
options.text: The V/P ratio is higher at the apex than at the base of the lungs when a person is standing.

options.label: D
options.text: Oxygen transfer can be explained by passive diffusion.

questions.correct_answer: A. The rate of alveolar ventilation at rest exceeds the rate of alveolar capillary perfusion.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) The rate of alveolar ventilation at rest exceeds the rate of alveolar capillary perfusion.

questions.text: A 35-year-old man visits his doctor because his wife has long complained of his snoring. He undergoes polysomnography and ventilatory response testing to ascertain the extent and cause of his sleep apnea. The activity of the central chemoreceptors is stimulated by which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: A decrease in the metabolic rate of the surrounding brain tissue

options.label: B
options.text: A decrease in the PO2 of blood flowing through the brain

options.label: C
options.text: An increase in the PCO2 of blood flowing through the brain

options.label: D
options.text: An increase in the pH of the CSF

questions.correct_answer: C. An increase in the PCO2 of blood flowing through the brain
questions.explanation: Ans. C) An increase in the PCO2 of blood flowing through the brain

questions.text: A 55yrs old smoker having difficulty in breathing was diagnosed with pulmonary lung fibrosis has saturation of 89%. The cause of this reduced saturation is defect in which mechanism?
Which of the following is most likely not involved in production of LTP?

A 60-year-old male patient presents with excessive thirst and reduced urine output. Laboratory investigations reveal high ADH level and high urine osmolarity. What is the most likely physiological stimulus for his thirst?

options.label: A
options.text: Increases in plasma osmolality and volume.

options.label: B
options.text: An increase in plasma osmolality and a decrease in plasma volume.

options.label: C
options.text: A decrease in plasma osmolality and an increase in plasma volume.

options.label: D
options.text: Injection of vasopressin into the hypothalamus.

questions.correct_answer: B. An increase in plasma osmolality and a decrease in plasma volume.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) An increase in plasma osmolality and a decrease in plasma volume.

questions.text: All of the following can be seen in lower motor neuron lesions, except?

Which one of the following statement accurately describes the a neurological phenomenon commonly observed in motor control and pivotal in maintaining appropriate muscle tension, involves a specific neuronal pathway with interneuronal processing between sensory and motor neurons, regulating muscle contraction by modulating motor neuron activity based on Golgi tendon organ input."

options.label: A
options.text: Occurs when IA spindle afferents are inhibited.

options.label: B
options.text: Is a monosynaptic reflex initiated by activation of the Golgi tendon organ.

options.label: C
options.text: Is a disynaptic reflex with a single interneuron inserted between the afferent and efferent limbs.

options.label: D
options.text: Uses type II afferent fibers from the Golgi tendon organ

questions.correct_answer: C. Is a disynaptic reflex with a single interneuron inserted between the afferent and efferent limbs.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Is a disynaptic reflex with a single interneuron inserted between the afferent and efferent limbs.

questions.text: A 29-year-old man is brought to the emergency room after a traffic accident causing a traumatic brain injury. Within several hours he begins eating objects such as paper, is unable to maintain attention, and displays increased sexual activity. He is diagnosed with Klüver-Bucy syndrome. A diagnostic MRI is ordered to confirm bilateral lesions of which of the following regions of the brain?

A 45-year-old woman presents to the sleep clinic with complaints of feeling unrefreshed after sleep and experiencing frequent awakenings. A polysomnography study is ordered, and the results show prominent features of sleep spindles and K-complexes. These findings are characteristic of which stage of sleep?
Which of the following types of neurons innervates the intrafusal fibers of the muscle spindle?

A 53 year old male is brought to the emergency department with complains of right sided weakness and jargon speech. A CT brain was ordered to rule out haemorrhagic stroke. On neurological examination, there is normal object recognition but loss of comprehension. Which of the following areas is affected?
Identify the sleep wave marked in the EEG during sleep wake cycle?

A 45-year-old patient visits a neurologist with a unique concern. The patient reports having difficulty recognizing familiar faces, including those of close family members and friends. This issue has been causing significant social discomfort. Which of the following conditions best describes the patient's symptoms?

A 72-year-old male is evaluated by a physiatrist after a stroke. The patient is observed to suffer from dysmetria, ataxia, and an intention tremor. These neurological signs are most likely related to a lesion within which of the following regions of the brain?

A 45-year-old male presents to the physician with significantly enlarged thyroid gland. Serum T3/T4 levels are decreased. lodine deficiency is suspected. Which of the following is the function of thyroid peroxidase in this patient?

In animal models of autosomal recessive polycystic kidney disease, epidermal growth factor (EGF) receptors may be abnormally expressed on the urine side of kidney epithelial cells and may be stimulated by EGF in the urine, causing excessive cell proliferation and formation of numerous kidney cysts. What type of drug might be useful in treating this condition?
Which of the following hormones act via JAK- STAT pathway?

A 30-year-old female patient experiencing irregular menstrual cycles and seeking guidance from her healthcare provider. During the healthcare team explores factors influencing reproductive hormone regulation. Which of the following have a role in controlling the secretion of Prolactin?
Urticaria is seen in a patient. The DLC that was done will most probably show?

A 44-year-old woman is referred to a neurologist by her family physician because of a recent loss of initiative, lethargy, memory problems, and a loss of vision. She is diagnosed with primary hypothyroidism and referred to an endocrinologist for treatment of her thyroid problem. All the following are functions of follicular cells except.

A 50-year-old patient presents with symptoms of hyperparathyroidism. Laboratory analysis shows elevated levels of parathyroid hormone (PTH). The accompanying graph shows changes in plasma calcium and phosphate levels after administration of PTH. Which of the following mechanisms explains how PTH increases plasma calcium levels?

options.label: B
options.text: By promoting calcium absorption in the intestines

options.label: C
options.text: By increasing both osteoclastic activity and reducing renal calcium excretion

options.label: D
options.text: By enhancing phosphate absorption in the intestine

questions.correct_answer: C. By increasing both osteoclastic activity and reducing renal calcium excretion
questions.explanation: Ans. C) By increasing both osteoclastic activity and reducing renal calcium excretion

questions.text: Increasing intracellular I – due to the action of NIS is an example of
Insulin increases the entry of glucose into

options.label: B
options.text: The mucosa of the small intestine.

options.label: C
options.text: Most neurons in the cerebral cortex.

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding acid secretion and urine acidification is/are correct? The proximal tubule has maximum acid secretion. The collecting duct is the primary site of urine acidification. The minimum urinary pH is 4.5, which is the limiting pH. The distal convoluted tubule (DCT) is more involved in bicarbonate reabsorption than acid secretion.

Which of the following graphs represent correct relationship between “mean arterial BP” and “plasma vasopressin(pmol/L)” Abscissa= mean arterial BP ; Ordinate= plasma vasopressin

A nephrology resident is planning a research study to assess renal function in patients with suspected chronic kidney disease. The study aims to accurately determine the filtration fraction of the kidneys. Which combination of substances should be used to measure glomerular filtration rate (GFR) and renal plasma flow (RPF) for calculating the filtration fraction?
Which of the following statements is true regarding the given cystometrogram?

options.label: A
options.text: Segment l gives a significant urge for urination due to increase in pressure

options.label: B
options.text: Segment II is due to Laplace law

options.label: C
options.text: Micturition fails to happen in segment II

options.label: D
options.text: The dotted line represents that micturition has occurred

questions.correct_answer: B. Segment II is due to Laplace law
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Segment II is due to Laplace Law

questions.text: Which of the following decreases GFR:

options.label: A
options.text: Increase in glomerular capillary hydrostatic pressure

options.label: B
options.text: Decrease in Glomerular capillary oncotic pressure

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in Bowmans capsule hydrostatic pressure

questions.correct_answer: D. Increase in Bowmans capsule hydrostatic pressure
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Increase in Bowmans capsule hydrostatic pressure

questions.text: A nephrologist is explaining to medical students the concept of renal clearance and how different substances are handled by the nephron. Using the graph provided, she asks them to match substances with their typical clearance patterns. Identify the correctly matched pair of substances with their renal clearance from the graph:

options.label: A
options.text: A - Glucose, B - PAH, C - Bicarbonate, D - Inulin

options.label: B
options.text: A - Bicarbonate, B - Glucose, C Inulin -, D – PAH

options.label: C
options.text: A - PAH, B - Inulin, C - Glucose, D - Bicarbonate

options.label: D
options.text: A - Glucose, B - Bicarbonate, C - Inulin, D - PAH

questions.correct_answer: D. A - Glucose, B - Bicarbonate, C - Inulin, D - PAH
questions.explanation: Ans. D) A - Glucose, B - Bicarbonate, C - Inulin, D – PAH

questions.text: A 55-year-old man with a history of chronic kidney disease undergoes evaluation of his renal function. A study is performed to assess the glomerular filtration barrier's selective permeability. The graph below shows the relative filterability of different substances through the kidney based on their molecular size and charge, with 1 representing complete filtration and 0 representing no filtration. Based on the graph, which of the following correctly identifies substances A, B, and C?

A 70-year-old man undergoing evaluation for renal function had a test substance administered to measure his renal clearance. Laboratory results show a urine concentration of the substance as 120 mg/mL, a plasma concentration of 40 mg/mL, and a urinary flow rate of 20 mL/min. What is the renal clearance of this substance?

A guinea-pig is dissected and a portion of its intestine is fixed in the modified Dales chamber to study the effects of some drugs on intestinal contractility. A substance X was infused in the broth following which the graph comes out as depicted. Substance X most closely resembles which of these substances?

Match the Following - Gastric Cell Secretions Column A (Cells) Surface cells Parietal cells Enterochromaffin cells Chief cells G cells (in Antrum) Column B (Secretions) Gastric acid and intrinsic factor Pepsinogen Gastrin Histamine (increases acid secretion) Mucous (bicarbonate-rich) to neutralize acid

A 57-year-old man with a history of chronic acid reflux presents with worsening symptoms of peptic ulcer disease. Which type of gastric mucosal cells is primarily responsible for secreting a hormone that stimulates the production of hydrochloric acid in the stomach, potentially exacerbating his condition?
The second phase of saliva secretion involves:

options.label: A
options.text: Active Na+ reabsorption, passive CI- reabsorption, passive K+ secretion, active secretion of HC03-

options.label: B
options.text: Passive Na+ reabsorption, active CI- reabsorption, passive K+ secretion, active secretion of HCO3-

options.label: C
options.text: Passive Na+ secretion, active CI- reabsorption, active K+ secretion, passive secretion of HCO3-

options.label: D
options.text: Active Na+ reabsorption, passive CI- reabsorption, active K+ secretion, passive secretion of HCO3-

questions.correct_answer: D. Active Na+ reabsorption, passive CI- reabsorption, active K+ secretion, passive secretion of HCO3-
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Active Na+ reabsorption, passive CI- reabsorption, active K+ secretion, passive secretion of HCO3-

questions.text: If pH of the blood is 7.8 and PCO2 is 50 mmHg and HCO3 is 30 mMol/liter the most suitable statement is.
questions.correct_answer: D. Metabolic alkalosis with respiratory compensation
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Metabolic alkalosis with respiratory compensation

questions.text: At a high altitude where atmospheric pressure is halved, there is an increase in
In acidosis, most of the hydrogen ions secreted by the proximal tubule are associated with which of the following processes?
Which of the following is not a measure of stroke volume?

options.label: A
options.text: Left ventricular end diastolic volume minus left ventricular end systolic volume

options.label: B
options.text: Ejection fraction times left ventricular end diastolic volume

questions.correct_answer: C. Ejection fraction times cardiac output
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Ejection fraction times cardiac output

questions.text: In a 45-year-old patient with a sudden-onset speech disorder, further investigations reveal a lesion in the left hemisphere involving the superior temporal gyrus and the posterior part of the left frontal lobe. The patient exhibits difficulty repeating spoken words without a corresponding impairment in language comprehension or production. Which intricate white matter tract is likely affected in this case?
The rod receptor potential differs from other sensory receptors in that it shows:
Which of the following neurons predominantly fire during forceful expiration?

A 65-year-old man with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) presents to the emergency department with severe shortness of breath. His oxygen saturation is low, and the medical team considers administering 100% oxygen. Which of the following best explains why administering pure oxygen to a patient with chronic hypoxia may be dangerous?

options.label: B
options.text: Apnea due to reduced stimulation of peripheral chemoreceptors

questions.correct_answer: B. Apnea due to reduced stimulation of peripheral chemoreceptors
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Apnea due to reduced stimulation of peripheral chemoreceptors

questions.text: A 60-year-old man presents with a head injury following a fall. On examination, he is found to have elevated blood pressure, a heart rate of 45 beats per minute, and irregular breathing patterns. Which of the following reflexes is most likely responsible for this presentation?
Which one of the following are used in calculating the serum osmolarity? 1. Serum sodium 2. Glucose 3. Calcium 4. Blood urea nitrogen
In a patient, the hypothalamic thermostat was reset from point V to point X as shown below. Which of the following happens in stage Y compared to stage W?
